page.title: 14A NEW LOOK AT RELIGION
page.content: IN 1966 AN{HISTORIC}EVENT TOOK PLACE WHEN A{CHURCH OF SCOTLAND}MINISTER AND {EPISCOPALIAN}PRIEST WERE INDUCTED TOGETHER AT A SHARED SERVICE IN THE KIRK OF CALDER FOR WORK IN THE{NEW {TOWN}OF LIVINGSTON.SO BEGAN THE LIVINGSTON{ECUMENICAL EXPERIMENT}WHICH INVOLVES FOUR{DENOMINATIONS}_THE CHURCH OF SCOTLAND,EPISCOPAL CHURCH, METHODIST CHURCH AND{CONGREGATIONAL {UNION}OF SCOTLAND.FIVE CONGREGATIONS NOW MEET IN THE TOWN AS PART OF THIS {ECUMENICAL}PROJECT.ALL OF THEM CONTAIN MEMBERS OF THE{FOUR DENOMINATIONS }AND HAVE EVERYTHING IN COMMON,MEETING TOGETHER FOR WORSHIP AND SHARING IN THE ORGANISATION OF THE CHURCH.THE { {BANGOUR VILLAGE HOSPITAL}CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1921 IN MEMORY OF THOSE WHO DIED IN THE WAR.THE CHURCH IS USED EVERY SUNDAY BY CHRISTIANS FOR BOTH R.C.AND PROTESTANT DENOMINATIONS.
